title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Trump Will Rename the Defense Department the Department of War: What to Know
items.description: The president has said the name “just sounded better” than Defense Department, a name that has been in use since 1949.

items.title: Chinese public is divided over whether to seek global dominance or share leadership

items.title: Elon Musk Could Become First Trillionaire Under New Tesla Pay Package
items.description: Tesla’s board unveiled a compensation package for the chief executive that could be worth $900 billion if he meets ambitious targets.

items.title: The world's oldest and largest iceberg will soon be no more

items.title: Mounting Deportations Meet Slow Hiring in a ‘Curious Kind of Balance’
items.description: An influx of immigrants helped ease worker shortages, and now their expulsion is helping to mask the country’s weakening demand for labor.

items.title: For first Black woman to design cars for Ford, passion for cars was a family affair
items.description: In this StoryCorps, Emeline King, the first Black woman to design cars for the Ford Motor Company, remembers her inspiration: her father.

items.title: 'One and done' dose of LSD keeps anxiety at bay
items.description: People with generalized anxiety disorder improved significantly after they got a single dose of LSD powerful enough to induce a psychedelic trip.

items.title: Trump to Sign Order Renaming the Defense Department as the Department of War
items.description: The president is turning back the clock to the name the agency held until shortly after World War II.

items.title: Why Hamas Refuses to Give Up Fighting
items.description: Analysts say that despite its vast losses in Gaza, Hamas believes it can hold out for a deal that ensures its survival.

items.title: A Nighttime Raid
items.description: An investigation details a previously undisclosed U.S. operation to intercept the North Korean leader’s communications.

items.title: French Winemaker Gets Prison for Selling Fake Champagne
items.description: Didier Chopin, 56, was accused of passing off wine made with carbonated grapes from Spain and other regions in France as Champagne.
